Welcome to the PRIME instance of the HARDCORE competition.

For the Platinum instance, please see this webpage (https://forums.elanthia.online/topic/116/gemstone-iv-platinum-hardcore)

The rules of the HARDCORE competition can be read in full on the gswiki here: https://gswiki.play.net/Prime_HARDCORE

Please do not enter without carefully reading and accepting to abide by the rules outlined above. Anyone found violating the rules of the competition, knowingly or otherwise, may be permanently banned from taking part. The onus is on the player to observe the rules of the competition, not for me to enforce compliance.

Please list your Prime HARDCORE character's Name, Race, Profession, and Character Location (if desired) in this thread to be officially entered into the competition. If your character is F2P, please state that as well. I will list each entrant to the competition in this thread as a matter of record.

Note: If/When your character dies, you are to post in this thread with the character's name and cause of death.

Wednesday, November 1st, 2017, 3:34:44 PM

I've updated the rules on the wiki to reflect recent questions and events.

  • Upon death you should submit a post to the thread informing the community of the character’s death and immediately delete the character. Inventory may be transferred to a non-HARDCORE character prior to deletion. Should you wish to create a new character for the HARDCORE competition, you must select a different name than the one used previously.

  • Participation in Societies, to include tasks requiring the direct involvement of other characters is permitted, as is the use of both HARDCORE and Non-HARDCORE characters to complete said tasks. MAing the required participants is not permitted.

Please let me know if you have any questions/comments/concerns over the new or already existing rules.

I have also created the Lnet Chat HARDCORE. Type ;tune HARDCORE or ;Chat on HARDCORE to make use of it.

A few notes.

  1. In a little over one week since going live, we now have over 30 active HARDCORE participants in the competition. My sincere thanks to everyone who decided to join in on the fun.

  2. The leaderboards have been significantly updated on the wiki and on each unofficial message board. Along with the standard Title/Level and Society achievements, Guild Skill, Artisan Skill, Locksmithing, and Adventurer Guild skills have also been added. In the near future I will announce prizes for some of these achievements, so be on the lookout!

  3. Two new rule changes have been drafted and will go into effect tomorrow (November 9th 2017) should there be no issues that arise after being reviewed by the HARDCORE community. Please see below and feel free to comment should you have questions, concerns, or suggestions. Note that these points are largely for clarification purposes and should not have an impact on your current method of playing.

HARDCORE characters may perform services for non-HARDCORE characters such as (but not limited to) Healing, Locksmithing, Spellups, Loresinging, Blessing, Armor Adjustment, Scroll Infusion, Enchanting, and Ensorcelling. However, the HARDCORE character may not receive any reward or payment for said service outside of those provided by the game itself (Experience, Guild Reps, etc). These services cannot be provided to an alternate account of the player (AKA MAing) and should not be abused solely to earn "safe" experience.

HARDCORE characters are not permitted to take part in pay festivals where real life currency is exchanged for a ticket such as Ebon Gate. Festivals that are free to all are permitted. The exception to this rule is if a HARDCORE character wins entry to a pay festival via in-game means such as finding a ticket in the treasure system. Should this occur, the participant must announce his win in an appropriate thread (See links at end of wiki page) in the interest of full disclosure.

  1. A player has suggested tracking original HARDCORE characters run by players who have yet to die during competition and marking them in the logs with an asterisk (*). This would provide a small bit of recognition for the longest running characters in the competition. An alternative option would be to provide a date of inception for each character to serve a similar purpose. If you have an opinion on the matter, please speak out and it will be taken into consideration moving forward.

Thanks for reading and good luck out there!

Evarin
Sunday, November 19th, 2017, 12:28:31 PM

A number of rules have either been added or further clarified.

HARDCORE characters may reroll prior to dying and keep their current name should they wish to do so. Aftering rerolling, new level, race, and profession information should be conveyed via updating the wiki or in a message board post in the appropriate thread.

Should a HARDCORE character receive outside spells from another player, they may dispel themselves using any available means to include an alternate account, fellow HARDCORE characters, or non-HARDCORE characters.

Items and silver may not be obtained from other characters. This means nothing may be received from another character or player shop, including character-to-character sales. All silver and inventory must be earned by the HARDCORE character. NPC shop purchases are permitted. Items the HARDCORE character obtained from a merchant, including raffles and merchant services, are permitted. Use of the pawnshop is allowed. However, no attempts should be made to knowingly buy or sell items to purposefully supply HARDCORE characters.

GemStone IV Prime HARDCORE characters shall at a minimum toggle on the ability to view their level in their profiles. It is recommended that the Strongest Foe toggle also be set, as well as any other appplicable toggles such as Warcamps, Lock, Trap, Guild, and Society.

Participation in Societies, to include tasks requiring the direct involvement of other characters is permitted, as is the use of both HARDCORE and Non-HARDCORE characters to complete said tasks. MAing the required participants is not permitted, nor is use of non-HARDCORE characters to make certain tasks easier, such as razing warcamps.

Also, it is important to remember that should your HARDCORE character die, you MUST either delete said character or reroll into a different name. Keeping the same name upon death creates a number of complications that are best avoided.

Monday, November 27th, 2017, 12:13:07 PM

The HARDCORE competition rules have been updated to include guidance on merchants, raffles, and games. The first bullet has not undergone any changes and is being included to act as a reference for the new addition.

  • Items from a grand auction, Duskruin, Delirium Manor or other "pay to play", or "1 win per account" sources are not permitted. Items from Reim are permitted but only from your daily free Reim run. Prizes obtained from OOG competitions or rewards such as (but not limited to) the Premium Monthly Submission contest, Indiegogo campaigns, GM/Gamehost/Mentor rewards, and CHE/MHO rewards are not permitted.

  • GM Merchant services, including premium only merchants, are allowed in all forms with the exception of the types of festivals outlined in the rules above. Raffles run by GMs or CHE/MHO organizations are also permitted. Participation and prizes involving all manner of games run by GMs are allowed to be entered by HARDCORE characters. Participation in games or competitions run by CHE/MHOs, groups, or individuals are allowed only if the chance of success is not guaranteed. The HARDCORE character may not receive spells, services, or hunt in groups with NON-HARDCORE characters during the course of these games. Prizes may be accepted for winning said games, but not solely for participation. Always remember the spirit of the HARDCORE competition and use your best judgement when participating in such activities.

God

Is it possible to just retire the character from Hardcore mode after death, why go so far to delete?

Evarin
Thursday, November 30th, 2017, 9:31:52 AM

@god said in Gemstone PRIME HARDCORE Official Thread:

Is it possible to just retire the character from Hardcore mode after death, why go so far to delete?

The point of the competition is to have dire consequences associated with character death. Strip the competition of said consequences and it fails to have a point. As has been mentioned before, there is no system in place that forces you to delete the character. However, as you are agreeing to the rules of the competition when you sign up, violating them would mean subsequent characters would not be considered as actual participants.

None of this is official, however. There's nothing stopping someone from breaking all the rules of the competition and claiming they are still a participant. Since its inception, no one has attempted any sort of disruptive behavior, but it's simply a matter of time before someone tries to do so. The situation will be dealt with as best as possible when and if the need arises.

@losus said in Gemstone PRIME HARDCORE Official Thread:

I know there had been interest in a hardcore themed MHO and I had been planning to do one but my present schedule hasn't allowed me to have dedicated time slots to do events.

I also don't want to create it purely on my own and would like help from the community on naming/ideas and events and how to keep it in line with RP.

I was thinking at the beginning of the year we could arrange an OOC table talk in either TV or WL and brainstorm on specifics for all of those who are interested. Once there is a general consensus we can then again on a first event date and time and I'll start all the other tasks involved.

If folks are on board I'll look at my calendar sometime this weekend for some dates for the OOC table talk

Thoughts?

I did a brief Q&A with people on the Lnet HARDCORE channel the other day brainstorming for ideas regarding a HC MHO. As mentioned before, a big perk would be to provide an IC explanation of why those in the group choose to play the way we do. That has already been discussed, though.

The other big point was to be able to provide the HC community with chances to exchange goods/services that would otherwise be against the rules or unavailable. There seemed to be general consensus that as long as there weren't just events that were excuses to spell each other up that people would be interested in joining and wouldn't see it as a gross violation of the spirit of the HARDCORE competition.

Group hunts would be one idea for events, but i'd also like to see swap meets, limited sales between HC characters, raffles/games/competitions for items that wouldn't normally be available due to being from pay festivals, etc.

Membership would have to be available to everyone so that no one would see the MHO as an unfair advantage or perk. I'd also like to see more input from HC folks to allow people to weigh in with their opinions on what they'd like to see from the group.

Evarin
Monday, December 4th, 2017, 7:09:15 PM

As requested, rules regarding group hunting have been clarified: When hunting with other HARDCORE characters, all members of the party should be able to gain experience from at least one of the creatures in the given area. Any member of the party may skin the corpse or loot the creature regardless of whether or not they landed the killing blow. However, loot may not be shared. Whoever performs skinning will keep the skin, and whoever loots the corpse keeps all resulting treasure. Silver/Loot may not be shared at any point once gained. Alternate taking turns skinning and/or looting should you wish to divide the spoils.

Monday, December 11th, 2017, 4:37:00 PM

Please be advised of two rule changes already reflected in the wiki:

Locksmithing - HARDCORE characters are permitted to open the boxes of other HARDCORE characters. The HARDCORE locksmith may not accept rewards for their efforts beyond the experience gained. Scarabs and trap components are considered the property of the locksmith. As mentioned elsewhere, HARDCORE locksmiths may also offer their services to non-HARDCORE clients as well.

Group Hunting - In order to promote group hunting, the restrictions on aiding your fellow competitors has been modified to allow the use of the following (Self-cast or item cast) spells: Stun Relief (108), Undisease (113), Unpoison (114), Spirit Guide (130), Calm (201), Untrammel (209), Minor Sanctuary (213), Major Sanctuary (220), Breeze (612), Celerity (506) [Group effect only], Traveler's Song (1020), Troubadour's Rally (1040), Adrenal Surge (1107), and Soothing Word (1202). In addition, it is permitted to drag your hunting partner to safety, or to execute them if there is risk of your partner(s) dying in battle (Deaths from CvC do not count towards elimination). Note that this list is in addition to the other spells allowed during group hunting, not in replacement thereof.

Tuesday, January 16th, 2018, 10:51:14 AM

The following rule changes have been made:

REMOVED: ~~In addition, it is permitted to drag your hunting partner to safety, or to execute them if there is risk of your partner(s) dying in battle (Deaths from CvC do not count towards elimination).~~

ADDED: PvP deaths in HARDCORE typically do not eliminate a competitor assuming the act was not done in an effort to avoid death via standard game mechanics. Player deaths that DO NOT cause elimination include CvC (in-character conflicts), deaths via fumbled traps (HARDCORE locksmith deaths are considered a legitimate elimination), and accidental non-HARDCORE player deaths in town or afield. Examples include getting caught in someone’s Major E-wave or Nature’s Fury while traveling. Death at the hands of your HARDCORE hunting partner(s) is considered a legitimate elimination, accidental or otherwise.

Summary: Due to competitor feedback, rules regarding PvP deaths have been amended to disallow killing a fellow competitor to aid him in avoiding elimination. The rules regarding PvP have also been clarified.

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, this is the place to voice them.

Monday, January 22nd, 2018, 1:22:20 PM

This week has been a fairly tumultuous one for HARDCORE, but not for the usual reasons. A vote was held to decide whether or not the rule regarding disqualification for failing to delete a fallen character should be changed. The results of the vote are in, 10 votes to keep the rules as they stand now, and 4 votes to change them. As such, the rule will stand that you must delete/reroll your HARDCORE character should they die during competition if you wish to enter a new one. Failure to do so will result in any future characters not being recognized as HARDCORE.

However, allowences have been made so that characters wishing to exempt their characters from deletion prior to dying can instead choose to RETIRE said character. Retirement removes the character from the competition, but leaves the player free to enter a new character in their stead. To be clear, the decision to retire a HARDCORE character must be made BEFORE their death, and is irreversible. The wiki will be updated with guidance on this issue before the end of the day. Speaking of retirement, Yimo, Chauvech, and Durie have all decided to hang up their hats and exit from the competition while still among the living. We wish them luck and much carefree hunting in the days to come.

Also exiting the competition in the usual way were Dredpok, the level 7 Dwarven Paladin via a Greater Orc's Broadsword. A pair of Burghal Gnomes Wizards also met their end. Scurf was eaten by a Werebear and Ratsil chopped down by a Wood Wight. It's been a rough few weeks for the Gnomes of late, but they're a determined bunch as Rattas the Burghal Gnome Wizard takes up his brother's (figurative) runestaff to tread on in his place. Also joining the ranks is Sindaras the Sylvankind Paladin and Eroland the Giantkin Empath. Finally, another of the Maza clan has risen to join the HARDCORE, going by the name of Maazikeen the 11th of her line. The Dark Elf Wizard is F2P as always and is tearing up the charts as we speak.

That'll do it for this week's roster update. Until next time, HARDCORE.

Monday, January 22nd, 2018, 2:06:33 PM

The wiki has been updated with the new retirement rules: * All HARDCORE competitors who have not yet been eliminated from the competition have the option to retire their character. Retirement allows the character to exit the competition, enabling the player to enter new competitors to the competition without having to delete their previous one. Retirement must be announced PRIOR to the HARDCORE character's elimination, and is irreversible. Leaderboard positions earned by the retired character shall remain in place as if they had been eliminated and any prizes won up to that point are theirs to keep.

Wednesday, January 24th, 2018, 10:43:40 AM

The wiki has had a few updates:

The first is purely cosmetic and involves reorganizing the leaderboards for the sake of clarity. Let me know if you spot any errors or inconsistencies.

The 2nd is the creation of the collapsible category, "HARDCORE - Inactive Adventurers". This category contains characters who have not been seen in the lands for at least 1 month's time. These characters are all still registered in the competition and nothing other than their listing on the Wiki has changed. If they are spotted in game they will be moved back onto the active roster. This change was made simply to make my life easier when parsing information on the wiki. If you feel you've been put on this list incorrectly, or ANY information is incomplete or incorrect, please let me know via the forums, Discord, or in game via Sulikfor on Lnet.
